articles.description: Reaction to the weekend's Premier League games, build-up to Everton v Crystal Palace and latest football news.
articles.title: Premier League reaction and football news

articles.description: Red Bull will be the focus of attention when Formula 1 pre-season testing starts this week in Bahrain - for reasons both on and off the track.
articles.title: F1 pre-season testing: Red Bull main focus as teams prepare for new season

articles.description: Newcastle United's sporting director Dan Ashworth is placed on gardening leave after telling the club he wants to join Manchester United.
articles.title: Ashworth on gardening leave amid Man Utd interest

articles.description: Harry Styles provides a sprinkle of stardust at Luton but Manchester United are left celebrating their own latest headline act in Rasmus Hojlund.
articles.title: 'Hojlund shows Styles why he is Man Utd's headline act'

articles.description: Damian Lillard scores 39 points as the Eastern Conference rack up a record 211 points to beat the Western Conference in the NBA All-Star Game.
articles.title: NBA: Damian Lillard named All-Star Game MVP in record East win over West

articles.description: Three-time Olympic medallist Shane Rose is cleared to compete after a review into his mankini outfit at an event on 11 February.
articles.title: Shane Rose: Show jumper cleared for competing in a mankini

articles.description: England scrum-half Alex Mitchell will miss the Six Nations match against Scotland with a knee injury.
articles.title: Mitchell out of Scotland match with knee injury

articles.description: England captain Harry Kane's late goal at Bochum is not enough as Bayern Munich suffer their third consecutive defeat in nine days.
articles.title: Kane goal not enough as Bayern Munich lose again

articles.description: Hideki Matsuyama comes back to win the Genesis Invitational after starting the day six shots behind.
articles.title: Genesis Invitational: Hideki Matsuyama wins ninth PGA Tour title after stunning fightback

articles.description: Tony Mowbray temporarily steps down as Birmingham City boss as he seeks medical treatment for an unnamed illness.
articles.title: Mowbray temporarily steps down as Birmingham boss
